channel.title: Posts on Noteworthy
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Noteworthy

item.title: Twemoji Support ðŸ¤©
item.description: If you want to use Twitter’s Twemoji across your website, enable it in your config.

item.title: Markdown Syntax
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: Placeholder Text
item.description: Lorem est tota propiore conpellat pectoribus de pectora summo.

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.

item.title: Emoji Support
item.description: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.

item.title: Render LaTeX using KaTeX
item.description: Enable katex by adding katex = "true" to the front matter

item.title: Theme Demo
item.description: Style Demo h1 Heading h2 Heading h3 Heading h4 Heading h5 Heading h6 Heading This is bold text

item.title: Creating a New Theme
item.description: Introduction This tutorial will show you how to create a simple theme in Hugo.

item.title: (Hu)go Template Primer
item.description: Hugo uses the excellent go html/template library for its template engine.

item.title: Getting Started with Hugo
item.description: Step 1. Install Hugo Goto hugo releases and download the appropriate version for your os and architecture.

item.title: Migrate to Hugo from Jekyll
item.description: Table of Contents Move static content to static Create your Hugo configuration file Set your configuration publish folder to site Convert Jekyll templates to Hugo templates Convert Jekyll plugins to Hugo shortcodes Implementation Usage Finishing Touches Fix Content Clean Up A practical example in a diff Move static content to static Jekyll has a rule that any directory not starting with _ will be copied as-is to the _site output.
